subject: Relationships
title: Small Moments Build Big Trust
description: A micro-lesson that makes Small Moments Build Big Trust usable.

hook.text: Trust isn't built in grand gestures. It's built in tiny moments â€” remembering a name, showing up on time, listening.

buildup.text: Gottman calls these 'sliding door moments' â€” small bids for connection that you either turn toward or turn away from.

discovery.text: Couples who turn toward bids 86% of the time stay together. Those at 33% divorce within six years.

twist.text: One heroic act doesn't build trust. But one thousand small, reliable acts do. Consistency is the architecture of trust.

climax.text: Trust is a marble jar. Each small act adds a marble. Each broken promise removes a handful. Fill it slowly.

punchline.text: Trust is built marble by marble. Small, consistent acts fill the jar.

quiz.question: What percentage of bids must couples turn toward to stay together?
